title: 111_hr6075
content: The Act titled "Ensuring Fairness for Fishermen Act" allows for the payment of costs, fees, and expenses incurred by certain prevailing parties. The Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act is amended to allow for the payment of sums received as fines, penalties, and forfeitures in certain cases, such as awards under specific sections of the United States Code. The Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act is amended to allow for the payment of sums received as fines, penalties, and forfeitures in specific cases, including awards to prevailing parties in civil actions or criminal actions under certain sections of the United States Code. The Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act is amended to allow for payment of fines, penalties, and forfeitures in certain cases. Payment will be made to the extent of available sums, with the remainder paid according to specific clauses in the United States Code. Additionally, attorney fees for substantially prevailing defendants are addressed in a new subsection of the Act. In a criminal action under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, a substantially prevailing defendant may receive reasonable attorney fees. SEC. 3. CERTAIN USES OF SUMS RECEIVED AS FINES, PENALTIES, AND FORFEITURES NO LONGER AUTHORIZED. Section 311(e)(1) of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act is amended by removing subparagraphs (B), (C), and (F). Conforming amendments include redesignating subparagraphs (D) and (E) as (B) and (C) respectively. Redesignated subparagraph (B) with left margin adjustment. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments made by this Act take effect on the date of enactment. Attorney fees for prevailing criminal defendants apply to actions brought after the enactment date, with a process for fee payments established within 180 days. Attorney fees for prevailing criminal defendants in actions under the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act must be applied for by the defendant and may be prorated if funds are insufficient. These fees are to be paid from sums described in section 311(e)(1) within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Commerce shall set aside an appropriate amount from funds described in section 311(e)(1) of the Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act for payments under this paragraph. The amendment does not apply to rewards for information provided before the enactment of the Act or expenses incurred before the enactment date. The amendment made by section 3(a)(3) does not apply to payment of reimbursements under agreements entered into before the date of the enactment of this Act.
